answerText: brittle fracture [or brittle failure][10] At stresses below the yield strength, this elastic modulus is the slope of the tensile stress-strain curve. It is named for an Englishman who demonstrated the wave nature of light with a double-slit experiment.
heading: ACF Regionals |2014 | Chicago A, Columbia A, and VCU | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name this type of failure which is contrasted with ductile failure, or yielding. It occurs via cleavage, not via necking.
